title: Electric PE - highest EPE of 3 charge systems

content.description: Figures <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> show three identical point charges with negative charge <math alttext="negative Q" overflow="scroll"> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mi>Q</mi> </math> in different arrangements. The distances between neighboring point charges, in terms of the distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, are indicated.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>U</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>, <math alttext="U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="U sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of the configurations in figures <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub 1 equals U sub 2, which equals U sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="U sub 2 is greater than U sub 1, which is greater than U sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="U sub 3 is greater than U sub 1, which is greater than U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, U sub 2 equals U sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than U sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub 2 is greater than U sub 1, which is greater than U sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
